meanings.sent1: The artist created an abstractional painting that only used shapes and colors.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style is very abstractional, focusing more on ideas than concrete details.
meanings.sent3: The abstractional concept of time travel in the movie made everyone scratch their heads.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked in an abstractional way, seeing patterns where others saw chaos.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used an abstractional example to explain complex math concepts to the students.

meanings.sent1: The company's approach to problem-solving was highly abstractional, always looking at the bigger picture.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher's theories were too abstractional for most people to understand easily.
meanings.sent3: The abstractional nature of the puzzle game made it both challenging and fun to play.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was so abstractional that it felt like listening to poetry rather than a lecture.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was deeply abstractional, leaving viewers to interpret its meaning in their own way.

meanings.sent1: The abstractional method used in coding simplified complex algorithms.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's research was highly abstractional, focusing on theoretical models.
meanings.sent3: The abstractional approach to problem-solving led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent4: Her abstractional thinking allowed her to see connections others missed.
meanings.sent5: The abstractional nature of the project required a creative and analytical mindset to complete.
